item.title: David add a quote by James Ellroy
item.description: "Anybody who doesn't know that politics is crime has got a few screws loose." -- James Ellroy

item.title: David add a quote by James Ellroy
item.description: "America was never innocent. We popped our cherry on the boat over and looked back with no regrets. You can't ascribe our fall from grace to any single event or set of circumstances. You can't lose what you lacked at conception." -- James Ellroy

item.title: David add a quote by James Ellroy
item.description: "To me, there's nothing on earth other than women. It's why I get out of bed every morning." -- James Ellroy

item.title: David add a quote by James Ellroy
item.description: "Dear FB Friends, Fuck Facebook!!!!! — It has proven to be worthless as a book-selling device, and is nothing but a repository for perverts, reparation-seekers, old buddies looking for handouts, syphillitic ex-girlfriends looking for extra-curricular schlong and hack writers begging for blurbs." -- James Ellroy

item.title: David add a quote by James Ellroy
item.description: "I am the son of a murdered woman—anybody who'd call my books misogynistic is, frankly, out of their fucking mind. " -- James Ellroy

item.title: David add a quote by James Ellroy
item.description: "My dad was always snoozing on the couch, like Dagwood Bumstead. He was a lazy motherfucker. God bless him. He was always working on some kind of get-rich-quick scheme. This is what my dad was like: I'd say, Hey, Dad, we studied penguins today in school. He'd say, Yeah? I'm a penguin fucker from way back. Dad, I saw a giraffe at the zoo today. Yeah? I'm a giraffe fucker from way back. That's my dad. My dad was a giraffe fucker." -- James Ellroy

item.title: David add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "If you reveal everything, bare every feeling, ask for understanding, you lose something crucial to your sense of yourself. You need to know things that others don't know. It's what no one knows about you that allows you to know yourself." -- Don DeLillo

item.title: David add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "There are dead stars that still shine because their light is trapped in time. Where do I stand in this light, which does not strictly exist?" -- Don DeLillo

item.title: David add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "When I read obituaries I always note the age of the deceased. Automatically I relate this figure to my own age. Four years to go, I think. Nine more years. Two years and I'm dead. The power of numbers is never more evident than when we use them to speculate on the time of our dying." -- Don DeLillo

item.title: David add a quote by Don DeLillo
item.description: "Insanity's so personal. It's hard to know who shares our secrets. " -- Don DeLillo

item.title: David add a quote by Peter Straub
item.description: "Sometimes it is right to fear the dark." -- Peter Straub
